definition: to formalize/formalism in art (esp. as proscribed in USSR and PRC)

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: He qifang's definition of poetry is obviously inclined to be formalism.
sentences.chinese: 何其芳的詩歌定義明顯具有公式化的傾向。

sentences.english: Product configuration. Is the design of formulation effective?
sentences.chinese: 產品結構。公式化的設計有效嗎？

sentences.english: The research on formulaic language can be traced back to the mid-nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: 人們對公式化語言的研究可以追溯到十九世紀中期。

sentences.english: Admissions decisions are not formula-driven but depend on an applicant's overall profile.
sentences.chinese: 行政決定並非公式化但會基於申請者的整體素質考慮。

sentences.english: The level of familiarity with the song lyrics and whether the texts contained formulaic phrases was found to be even more important.
sentences.chinese: 對歌詞的熟悉度以及文字是否包含公式化短語更重要。

definition: to do things in a strictly businesslike manner (idiom)
